Paragraph.Text: conduct enhanced ongoing monitoring of the activities in respect of the account for the purpose of detecting transactions that are required to be reported to the Centre under section 7 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: A financial entity or securities dealer shall also take the measures referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: they determine under paragraph 54.2(1)(a), subsection 54.2(2) or (3) or section 57.1 that a person is a politically exposed domestic person, a head of an international organization or a family member of one of those persons or they determine under subsection 54.2(3) or 57.1(3) that a person is closely associated with a politically exposed domestic person or a head of an international organization; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: they consider, based on an assessment of the risk referred to in subsection 9.6(2) of the Act, that there is a high risk of a money laundering offence or terrorist activity financing offence.

Subsection.Text: A financial entity or securities dealer shall take the reasonable measures referred to in paragraph 54.2(1)(a) and subsections 54.2(3) and 57.1(1) and (3) — and, if applicable, shall take the measures referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) — within 30 days after the day on which the account is opened or the day on which the fact that constitutes the reasonable grounds to suspect is detected, as the case may be.

A financial entity, life insurance company, life insurance broker or agent or money services business that determines under paragraph 54.2(1)(b), section 56.1 or paragraph 59(5)(a) that a person is a politically exposed foreign person or a family member of, or person who is closely associated with, such a person shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable measures to establish the source of the funds that have been used for the transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that a member of senior management reviews the transaction.

Subsection.Text: A financial entity, life insurance company, life insurance broker or agent or money services business shall also take the measures referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) if they determine under paragraph 54.2(1)(b), section 56.1 or paragraph 59(5)(a) that a person is a politically exposed domestic person, a head of an international organization or a family member of, or person who is closely associated with, one of those persons and they consider, based on an assessment of the risk referred to in subsection 9.6(2) of the Act, that there is a high risk of a money laundering offence or terrorist activity financing offence.

A financial entity or money services business that determines under paragraph 54.2(1)(c) or 59(5)(b) that a person is a politically exposed foreign person or a family member of, or person who is closely associated with, such a person shall ensure that a member of senior management reviews the transaction.

A financial entity or money services business shall also take the measure referred to in subsection (3) if they determine under paragraph 54.2(1)(c) or 59(5)(b) that a person is a politically exposed domestic person, a head of an international organization or a family member of, or person who is closely associated with, one of those persons and they consider, based on an assessment of the risk referred to in subsection 9.6(2) of the Act, that there is a high risk of a money laundering offence or terrorist activity financing offence.

A financial entity, life insurance company, life insurance broker or agent or money services business shall take the reasonable measures referred to in paragraphs 54.2(1)(b) and (c), section 56.1 and paragraphs 59(5)(a) and (b) — and, if applicable, shall take the measures referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) or that referred to in subsection (3), as the case may be — within 30 days after the day on which the transaction occurs.

Heading.TitleText: Reasonable Measures

Section.Text: If the reasonable measures taken by a person or entity under paragraph 9.5(b) of the Act or under subsection 8(1), 9(1) or 10(1), paragraph 11.1(4)(a) or 14.1(d), subsection 15.1(3), 39(5), 42(3) or (4) or 44(1), paragraph 50(1)(e), subsection 52(1) or (3) or 53.1(1), any of paragraphs 54.2(1)(a) to (c), subsection 54.2(2) or (3), paragraph 55.1(b), section 55.2, 56.1 or 57.1, paragraph 59(5)(a) or (b), subsection 59.2(3), paragraph 67.1(1)(a), subsection 67.1(2), paragraph 67.2(1)(a) or subsection 67.2(2) are unsuccessful, the person or entity shall keep a record that sets out the measures taken, the date on which each measure was taken, and the reasons why the measures were unsuccessful.

Heading.TitleText: Retention of Records

Section.Text: If a record is required to be kept under these Regulations, the record or a copy of it may be kept in a machine-readable or electronic form if a paper copy can be readily produced from it.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), every person or entity that is required to obtain, keep or create records under these Regulations shall retain those records for a period of at least five years following

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of signature cards, account operating agreements, account application forms, credit card applications and records setting out the intended use of the account, the day on which the account to which they relate is closed;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of records that are required to be kept under paragraph 14(i) or (n), 14.1(g) or 23(f), the day on which the account to which they relate is closed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of client information records, certificates of corporate status, records that are required to be filed annually under the applicable provincial securities legislation or other similar records that ascertain the existence of a corporation, and records that ascertain the existence of an entity, other than a corporation, including partnership agreements and articles of association, the day on which the last business transaction is conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of records that are required to be kept under section 11.1, paragraph 14(o), subsection 15.1(2) or section 20.1 or 31, lists that are required to be kept under section 32 and records, other than client information records, that are required to be kept under that section, the day on which the last business transaction is conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of all other records, the day on which they were created.

Subsection.Text: Where records that an individual keeps under these Regulations are the property of the individual’s employer or a person or entity with which the individual is in a contractual relationship, the individual is not required to retain the records after the end of the individual’s employment or contractual relationship.

Section.Text: Every record that is required to be kept under these Regulations shall be retained in such a way that it can be provided to an authorized person within 30 days after a request is made to examine it under section 62 of the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Compliance

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection 9.6(1) of the Act, a person or entity referred to in that subsection shall, as applicable, implement the compliance program referred to in that subsection by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appointing a person — who, where the compliance program is being implemented by a person, may be that person — who is to be responsible for the implementation of the program;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: developing and applying written compliance policies and procedures that are kept up to date and, in the case of an entity, are approved by a senior officer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: assessing and documenting, in a manner that is appropriate for the person or entity, the risk referred to in subsection 9.6(2) of the Act, taking into consideration

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s clients and business relationships,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s products and delivery channels,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the geographic location of the person’s or entity’s activities,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii.1)
Subparagraph.Text: any new developments in respect of, or the impact of new technologies on, the person’s or entity’s clients, business relationships, products or delivery channels or the geographic location of their activities,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii.2)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an entity that is referred to in any of paragraphs 5(a) to (g) of the Act, any risk resulting from the activities of an entity that is affiliated with it and that is referred to in any of those paragraphs or from the activities of a foreign entity that is affiliated with it and that carries out activities that are similar to those of entities referred to in any of those paragraphs, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: any other relevant factor;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the person or entity has employees, agents or mandataries or other persons authorized to act on their behalf, developing and maintaining a written, ongoing compliance training program for those employees, agents or mandataries or other persons; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: instituting and documenting a review of the policies and procedures, the risk assessment and the training program for the purpose of testing their effectiveness, which review is required to be carried out every two years by an internal or external auditor of the person or entity, or by the person or entity if they do not have such an auditor.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the compliance program referred to in subsection 9.6(1) of the Act, every entity referred to in that subsection shall report the following in written form to a senior officer within 30 days after the assessment:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the findings of the review referred to in paragraph (1)(e);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any updates made to the policies and procedures within the reporting period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the status of the implementation of the updates to those policies and procedures.

Section.Text: The prescribed special measures that are required to be taken by a person or entity referred to in subsection 9.6(1) of the Act for the purpose of subsection 9.6(3) of the Act are the development and application of written policies and procedures for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: taking enhanced measures based on the risk assessment undertaken in accordance with subsection 9.6(2) of the Act to ascertain the identity of any person or confirm the existence of any entity in addition to the measures required in sections 54, 54.1, 55, 56, 57, 59 and 59.1, subsection 59.2(1), section 59.3, subsection 59.4(1) and sections 59.5, 60 and 61; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: taking any other enhanced measure to mitigate the risks identified in accordance with subsection 9.6(3) of the Act, including,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: keeping client identification information and the information referred to in section 11.1 up to date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in addition to the measures required in sections 54.3, 56.3, 57.2, 59.01, 59.11, 59.21, 59.31, 59.41, 59.51, 60.1 and 61.1, conducting ongoing monitoring of business relationships for the purpose of detecting transactions that are required to be reported to the Centre under section 7 of the Act.

Heading.TitleText: Coming into Force

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), these Regulations come into force on June 12, 2002.
The following provisions come into force on the dates indicated:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: paragraph 12(1)(a), sections 17, 21, 24, 28, 32, 35, 38, 40, 47, 50 and 51 and Schedules 1 and 4 on January 31, 2003.

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: sections 72 to 76 and Schedules 5 and 6 on March 31, 2003.

Heading.Label: PART A
Heading.TitleText: Information on Place of Business Where Transaction Occurred

Item.Text: Type of reporting person or entity, as described in paragraphs 5(a) to (h), (k) and (l) of the Act, and, if reporting person or entity is referred to in paragraph 5(i) or (j) of the Act, type of business, profession or activity of reporting person or entity, as described in sections 16, 34, 37, 45 and 46 of these Regulations
Identification number of place of business where transaction occurred (e.g., institution’s identification number, licence number or registration number), if applicable
Full name of reporting person or entity
Full address of place of business where transaction occurred
Name and telephone number of contact person

Heading.Label: PART B
Heading.TitleText: Information on Transaction

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2016-153, s. 124, as amended by SOR/2017-115, s. 1

Section.Text: A person or entity may, during the period that begins on the day on which section 70 of these Regulations comes into force and ends on January 23, 2018, comply with subsection 64(1) or (1.1) and sections 64.1 and 67 of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Regulations, as they read immediately before the day on which that section 70 comes into force.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 22, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 2

Subsection.Text: Subsection 1(1) of the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Regulations2 is replaced by the following:
In the Act and in these Regulations, shell bank means a foreign financial institution that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not have a place of business that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is located at a fixed address — where it employs one or more persons on a full-time basis and maintains operating records related to its banking activities — in a country in which it is authorized to conduct banking activities, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is subject to inspection by the regulatory authority that licensed it to conduct banking activities; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is not controlled by, or under common control with, a depository institution, credit union or foreign financial institution that maintains a place of business referred to in paragraph (a) in Canada or in a foreign country.

Subsection.Text: The definitions business relationship, CICA Handbook, client information record, ongoing monitoring, physical presence and transaction ticket in subsection 1(2) of the Regulations are repealed.

The definitions accountant, British Columbia notary corporation, dealer in precious metals and stones, deposit slip, electronic funds transfer, financial entity, financial services cooperative, funds, large cash transaction record, life insurance broker or agent, real estate broker or sales representative, receipt of funds record and trust company in subsection 1(2) of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: accountant means a chartered accountant, a certified general accountant, a certified management accountant or, if applicable, a chartered professional accountant. (comptable)

British Columbia notary corporation means an entity that carries on the business of providing notary services to the public in British Columbia in accordance with the Notaries Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 334. (société de notaires de la Colombie-Britannique)

dealer in precious metals and precious stones means a person or entity that, in the course of their business activities, buys or sells precious metals, precious stones or jewellery. It includes a department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province when the department or the agent or mandatary carries out the activity, referred to in subsection 65(1), of selling precious metals to the public. (négociant en métaux précieux et pierres précieuses)
deposit slip means a record that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the deposit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person or entity that makes the deposit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the deposit and of any part of it that is made in cash;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the deposit is made; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the account into which the deposit is made and the name of each account holder. (relevé de dépôt)

Definition.Text: electronic funds transfer means the transmission — by any electronic, magnetic or optical means — of instructions for the transfer of funds, including a transmission of instructions that is initiated and finally received by the same person or entity. In the case of SWIFT messages, only SWIFT MT-103 messages and their equivalent are included. It does not include a transmission of instructions for the transfer of funds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is carried out by means of a credit or debit card or a prepaid payment product if the beneficiary has an agreement with the payment service provider that permits payment by that means for the provision of goods and services;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that involves the beneficiary withdrawing cash from their account;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is carried out by means of a direct deposit or a pre-authorized debit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that is carried out by cheque imaging and presentment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: that is both initiated and finally received by persons or entities that are acting to clear or settle payment obligations between themselves; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: that is initiated or finally received by a person or entity referred to in paragraphs 5(a) to (h.1) of the Act for the purpose of internal treasury management, including the management of their financial assets and liabilities, if one of the parties to the transaction is a subsidiary of the other or if they are subsidiaries of the same corporation. (télévirement)

Definition.Text: financial entity means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an entity that is referred to in any of paragraphs 5(a), (b) and (d) to (f) of the Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a financial services cooperative;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a life insurance company, or an entity that is a life insurance broker or agent, in respect of loans or prepaid payment products that it offers to the public and accounts that it maintains with respect to those loans or prepaid payment products, other than

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: loans that are made by the insurer to a policy holder if the insured person has a terminal illness that significantly reduces their life expectancy and the loan is secured by the value of an insurance policy;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: loans that are made by the insurer to the policy holder for the sole purpose of funding the life insurance policy; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: advance payments to which the policy holder is entitled that are made to them by the insurer;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a credit union central when it offers financial services to a person, or to an entity that is not a member of that credit union central; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a department, or an entity that is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province, when it carries out an activity referred to in section 76. (entité financière)

Definition.Text: financial services cooperative means a financial services cooperative that is regulated by An Act respecting financial services cooperatives, CQLR, c. C-67.3, other than a caisse populaire. (coopérative de services financiers)
funds means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cash and other fiat currencies, and securities, negotiable instruments or other financial instruments that indicate a title or right to or interest in them; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a private key of a cryptographic system that enables a person or entity to have access to a fiat currency other than cash.

ContinuedDefinition.Text: For greater certainty, it does not include virtual currency. (fonds)

Definition.Text: large cash transaction record means a record that indicates the receipt of an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount is received for deposit into an account, the number of the account, the name of each account holder and the time of the deposit or an indication that the deposit is made in a night deposit box outside the recipient’s normal business hours;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of every other person or entity that is involved in the transaction, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type and amount of each fiat currency involved in the receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the cash is received;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the number of every other account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose of the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the following details of the remittance of, or in exchange for, the cash received:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in funds, the type and amount of each type of funds involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in funds, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of cash received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of every person or entity involved in the remittance and their account number or policy number or, if they have no account number or policy number, their identifying number; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount is received by a dealer in precious metals and precious stones for the sale of precious metals, precious stones or jewellery,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of precious metals, precious stones or jewellery,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the value of the precious metals, precious stones or jewellery, if different from the amount of cash received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the wholesale value of the precious metals, precious stones or jewellery. (relevé d’opération importante en espèces)

Definition.Text: life insurance broker or agent means a person or entity that is authorized under provincial legislation to carry on the business of arranging contracts of life insurance. (représentant d’assurance-vie)

real estate broker or sales representative means a person or entity that is authorized under provincial legislation to act as an agent or mandatary for purchasers or vendors in respect of the purchase or sale of real property or immovables. (courtier ou agent immobilier)
receipt of funds record means a record that indicates the receipt of an amount of funds and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount is received from a person, their name, address and date of birth and the nature of their principal business or their occupation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount is received from or on behalf of an entity, the entity’s name and address and the nature of its principal business;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the funds received and of any part of the funds that is received in cash;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the amount is received;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the type and amount of each fiat currency involved in the receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction in which the receipt occurs, the type of account and the name of each account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of every other person or entity that is involved in the transaction, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the purpose of the transaction. (relevé de réception de fonds)

Definition.Text: trust company means a company that is referred to in any of paragraphs 5(d) to (e.1) of the Act. (société de fiducie)

Subsection.Text: The definition cabinet d’expertise comptable in subsection 1(2) of the French version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: cabinet d’expertise comptable Entité qui exploite une entreprise qui fournit des services d’expertise comptable au public et qui compte au moins un comptable parmi ses associés, ses employés ou ses gestionnaires. (accounting firm)

Subsection.Text: The definition cash in subsection 1(2) of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: cash means coins referred to in section 7 of the Currency Act, notes issued by the Bank of Canada under the Bank of Canada Act that are intended for circulation in Canada or coins or bank notes of countries other than Canada. (espèces)

Subsection.Text: The definitions fiche-signature and signature in subsection 1(2) of the French version of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: fiche-signature S’entend, à l’égard d’un compte, du document signé par une personne habilitée à donner des instructions à l’égard du compte ou des données électroniques constituant la signature d’une telle personne. (signature card)

signature S’entend notamment d’une signature électronique ou de tout autre renseignement électronique créé ou adopté par le client d’une personne ou entité visée à l’article 5 de la Loi et que cette personne ou entité reconnaît comme étant propre à ce client. (signature)

Subsection.Label: (7) to (10)
Subsection.Text: [Repealed before coming into force, SOR/2020-112, s. 2]

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province;

Subsection.Text: The portion of the definition real estate developer in subsection 1(2) of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: real estate developer means a person or entity that, in any calendar year after 2007, has sold to the public, other than in the capacity of a real estate broker or sales representative,

Subsection.Text: The portion of the definition senior officer in subsection 1(2) of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: senior officer, in respect of an entity, means

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (a) and (b) of the definition cadre dirigeant in subsection 1(2) of the French version of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Text: de l’administrateur de cette entité qui en est l’employé à temps plein;

Paragraph.Label: b)

Subsection.Text: [Repealed before coming into force, SOR/2020-112, s. 2]
The portion of the definition organisme public in subsection 1(2) of the French version of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: organisme public S’entend :

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (b) and (c) of the definition organisme public in subsection 1(2) of the French version of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: b)
Paragraph.Text: d’une administration métropolitaine, d’une ville, d’un village, d’un canton, d’un district, d’un comté ou d’une municipalité rurale constitué en personne morale ou d’un autre organisme municipal au Canada ainsi constitué, ou d’un mandataire de ceux-ci au Canada;

Paragraph.Label: c)
Paragraph.Text: d’une institution qui exploite un hôpital public et qui est désignée comme administration hospitalière par le ministre du Revenu national aux termes de la Loi sur la taxe d’accise, ou de tout mandataire de celle-ci. (public body)

Subsection.Text: [Repealed before coming into force, SOR/2020-112, s. 2]
Subsection 1(2) of the Regulations is amended by adding the following in alphabetical order:

Definition.Text: authorized user means a person who is authorized by a holder of a prepaid payment product account to have electronic access to funds or virtual currency available in the account by means of a prepaid payment product that is connected to it. (utilisateur autorisé)
casino means a government, organization, board or operator that is referred to in any of paragraphs 5(k) to (k.3) of the Act. (casino)
fiat currency means a currency that is issued by a country and is designated as legal tender in that country. (monnaie fiduciaire)
final receipt, in respect of an electronic funds transfer, means the receipt of the instructions by the person or entity that is to make the remittance to a beneficiary. (destinataire)
foreign currency means a fiat currency that is issued by a country other than Canada. (devise)
foreign currency exchange transaction means an exchange, at the request of another person or entity, of one fiat currency for another. (opération de change en devise)
foreign currency exchange transaction ticket means a record respecting a foreign currency exchange transaction — including an entry in a transaction register — that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transaction of $3,000 or more, the name and address of the person or entity that requests the exchange, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type and amount of each of the fiat currencies involved in the payment made and received by the person or entity that requests the exchange;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the payment is made and received;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number; (fiche d’opération de change en devise)

Definition.Text: foreign money services business means a person or entity referred to in paragraph 5(h.1) of the Act. (entreprise de services monétaires étrangère)
information record means a record that sets out the name and address of a person or entity and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a person, their date of birth and the nature of their principal business or their occupation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an entity, the nature of its principal business. (dossier de renseignements)

Definition.Text: initiation, in respect of an electronic funds transfer, means the first transmission of the instructions for the transfer of funds. (amorcer)
international electronic funds transfer means an electronic funds transfer other than for the transfer of funds within Canada. (télévirement international)

large virtual currency transaction record means a record that indicates the receipt of an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction and that contains the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount is received for deposit into an account, the name of each account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of every other person or entity that is involved in the transaction, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency involved in the receipt;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number of every other account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if the amount is received by a dealer in precious metals and precious stones for the sale of precious metals, precious stones or jewellery,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of precious metals, precious stones or jewellery,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the value of the precious metals, precious stones or jewellery, if different from the amount of virtual currency received, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the wholesale value of the precious metals, precious stones or jewellery. (relevé d’opération importante en monnaie virtuelle)

Definition.Text: prepaid payment product means a product that is issued by a financial entity and that enables a person or entity to engage in a transaction by giving them electronic access to funds or virtual currency paid to a prepaid payment product account held with the financial entity in advance of the transaction. It excludes a product that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: enables a person or entity to access a credit or debit account or one that is issued for use only with particular merchants; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is issued for single use for the purposes of a retail rebate program. (produit de paiement prépayé)

Definition.Text: prepaid payment product account means an account — other than an account to which only a public body or, if doing so for the purposes of humanitarian aid, a registered charity as defined in subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act, can add funds or virtual currency — that is connected to a prepaid payment product and that permits

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: funds or virtual currency that total $1,000 or more to be added to the account within a 24-hour period; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a balance of funds or virtual currency of $1,000 or more to be maintained. (compte de produit de paiement prépayé)

Definition.Text: virtual currency means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a digital representation of value that can be used for payment or investment purposes, that is not a fiat currency and that can be readily exchanged for funds or for another virtual currency that can be readily exchanged for funds; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a private key of a cryptographic system that enables a person or entity to have access to a digital representation of value referred to in paragraph (a). (monnaie virtuelle)

Definition.Text: virtual currency exchange transaction means an exchange, at the request of another person or entity, of virtual currency for funds, funds for virtual currency or one virtual currency for another. (opération de change en monnaie virtuelle)
virtual currency exchange transaction ticket means a record respecting a virtual currency exchange transaction — including an entry in a transaction register — that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a transaction of $1,000 or more, the name and address of the person or entity that requests the exchange, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds and each of the virtual currencies involved in the payment made and received by the person or entity that requests the exchange;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the payment is made and received;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses. (fiche d’opération de change en monnaie virtuelle)

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 23, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 3

Section.Text: Sections 1.1 to 8 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 9.3(1) of the Act, a prescribed family member of a politically exposed foreign person, a politically exposed domestic person or a head of an international organization is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: their spouse or common-law partner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: their child;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: their mother or father;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the mother or father of their spouse or common-law partner; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a child of their mother or father.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the definitions head of an international organization and politically exposed domestic person in subsection 9.3(3) of the Act, the prescribed period is five years.

Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 5(l) of the Act, the prescribed precious metals are those defined as precious metals in subsection 1(2).

For the purposes of these Regulations, an entity is affiliated with another entity if one of them is wholly owned by the other, if both are wholly owned by the same entity or if their financial statements are consolidated.
For the purposes of these Regulations, a person or entity to which section 5 of the Act applies enters into a business relationship with a client at the earliest of the following events:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the time when the person or entity opens an account for the client, except in the circumstances set out in any of paragraphs 154(1)(a) to (d) and (2)(a) to (l) and (p) and subsection 154(3),

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the second time that the person or entity is required to verify the identity of the client under these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the person or entity is a real estate broker or sales representative or a real estate developer, the first time that the person or entity is required to verify the identity of the client under these Regulations,

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the person or entity is a money services business and the client is an entity, the time when the person or entity enters into a service agreement with the client to provide a service referred to in any of subparagraphs 5(h)(i) to (v) of the Act, and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the person or entity is a foreign money services business and the client is an entity in Canada, the time when the person or entity enters into a service agreement with the client to provide a service referred to in any of subparagraphs 5(h.1)(i) to (v) of the Act.

Heading.Label: PART 1
Heading.TitleText: Requirements To Report Transactions and To Keep Records
Application of Parts 5 and 6

Section.Text: The provisions of this Part are subject to the provisions of Parts 5 and 6.

Heading.TitleText: Financial Entities

Subsection.Text: A financial services cooperative is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(i) of the Act.

A credit union central is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(j) of the Act when it offers financial services to a person, or to an entity that is not a member of that credit union central.
A financial entity shall report the following transactions and information to the Centre:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity of an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the initiation, at the request of a person or entity, of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the final receipt of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity of an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

Subsection.Text: A financial entity is not required to report the transaction and information under paragraph (1)(a), if the amount is received from another financial entity or a public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
A financial entity is not required to report the transaction and information under paragraph 7(1)(a) if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the entity from which or on whose behalf the financial entity receives the amount is a corporation that carries on business as an establishment described in sector 22, 44 (excluding codes 4411, 4412 and 44831) or 45 (excluding code 45392), or code 481, 482, 485 (excluding code 4853), 51711, 51751, 61121 or 61131 of the North American Industry Classification System as that sector or code read on January 31, 2003;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount received is deposited into an account held by the corporation with the financial entity in respect of that business;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the corporation has had

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the entire preceding 24-month period, an account in respect of that business with the financial entity, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an account in respect of that business with another financial entity for a continuous period of 24 months ending immediately before the corporation opened an account with the financial entity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the financial entity has records that indicate that the corporation has deposited an amount of $10,000 or more in cash into that account on an average of at least twice a week during the preceding 12 months;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the cash deposits made by the corporation are consistent with the corporation’s usual practice in respect of the business;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the financial entity has taken reasonable measures to determine the source of the cash for those deposits; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the financial entity provides to the Centre the information set out in Schedule 5.

Subsection.Text: A corporation referred to in paragraph (1)(a) does not include one that carries on a business related to pawnbroking or whose principal business is the sale of vehicles, vessels, farm machinery, aircraft, mobile homes, jewellery, precious stones, precious metals, antiquities or art.
A financial entity that, in accordance with subsection (1), does not report a transaction and information

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall report to the Centre a change to the corporation’s name or address, the nature of the corporation’s business or the corporation’s incorporation number within 15 days after the day on which the change is made; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall, at least once every 12 months,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: verify that the conditions referred to in subsection (1) continue to be met,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: ensure that a senior officer of the financial entity confirms that those conditions continue to be met, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: send a report to the Centre setting out the corporation’s name and address and the name of the senior officer who gave the confirmation.

Subsection.Text: Subsections 9(1) to (5) of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

A person or entity that is required under these Regulations to keep a signature card or an account operating agreement shall, when they open the account, take reasonable measures to determine whether the account will be used by or on behalf of a third party.

If the person or entity determines that the account will be used by or on behalf of a third party, the person or entity shall take reasonable measures to obtain the following information and shall keep a record of the information obtained:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is a person, their name, address, telephone number and date of birth and the nature of their principal business or their occupation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the third party is an entity, its name, address and telephone number, the nature of its principal business, its registration or incorporation number and the jurisdiction and country of issue of that number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the relationship between the third party and each account holder.

Subsection.Text: If the person or entity is not able to determine whether the account will be used by or on behalf of a third party but there are reasonable grounds to suspect that it will, the person or entity shall keep a record that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: indicates whether, according to a person who is authorized to act in respect of the account, the account will only be used by or on behalf of an account holder; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: describes the reasonable grounds to suspect that the account will be used by or on behalf of a third party.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply if every account holder is a financial entity or a securities dealer that is engaged in the business of dealing in securities in Canada.

Subsection (2) does not apply if a securities dealer is required to keep an account operating agreement in respect of an account of a person or entity that is engaged in the business of dealing in securities only outside Canada and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the account is in a country that is a member of the Financial Action Task Force;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the account is in a country that is not a member of the Financial Action Task Force but has implemented the Financial Action Task Force’s recommendations relating to client identification and, when the account is opened, the securities dealer has obtained written assurance from the account holder that the country has implemented those recommendations; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the account is in a country that is not a member of the Financial Action Task Force and has not implemented the Financial Action Task Force’s recommendations relating to client identification but, when the account is opened, the securities dealer has verified the identity of all third parties in accordance with subsection 105(1), 109(1) or 112(1).

Subsection.Text: Section 9 of the Regulations is renumbered as section 135 and is repositioned accordingly.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 25, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 4

Section.Text: Sections 10 and 11 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:
A financial entity that maintains a list of clients for the purposes of subsection 9(3) of the Act shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: include the name and address of each client in the list; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: maintain the list in paper form, or in a machine-readable or electronic form if a paper copy can readily be produced from it.

Section.Text: A financial entity shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that it receives from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from another financial entity or a public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A financial entity shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that it receives from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from another financial entity or a public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
A financial entity shall keep the following records in respect of every account that it opens and of every transaction that is conducted with it, other than those referred to in section 13 or 14:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every signature card;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a record for each account holder and every other person — up to three, in the case of a business account — who is authorized to give instructions in respect of the account, containing their name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if an account holder is a corporation, a copy of the part of its official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of the account or transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a record that sets out the intended use of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a record of every application in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: every account operating agreement that it creates or receives in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a deposit slip in respect of every deposit that is made into the account;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: every debit and credit memo that it creates or receives in respect of the account, except debit memos that relate to another account at the same branch of the financial entity that created the debit memo;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of every account statement that it sends to an account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: every cleared cheque that is drawn on, and a copy of every cleared cheque that is deposited into, the account, unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the account on which the cheque is drawn and the account into which the cheque is deposited are at the same branch of the financial entity, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following conditions are met:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: an image of the cheque has been recorded on microfilm or on an electronic medium,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an image of the cheque can be readily reproduced from the microfilm or electronic medium,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: it is possible to readily ascertain where the image of the cheque is recorded, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the microfilm or electronic medium is kept for a period of at least five years after the day on which the image of the cheque is recorded;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of every credit arrangement that it enters into with a client, a record of the client’s financial capacity, the terms of the credit arrangement, the nature of the client’s principal business or their occupation and, if the client is a person, the name and address of their business or place of work;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every foreign currency exchange transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: if it receives an amount of $3,000 or more as consideration for the issuance of traveller’s cheques, money orders or similar negotiable instruments from a person or entity other than another financial entity or a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity, a record

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of the date of the receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of the amount received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: indicating whether the amount received is in funds or virtual currency and the type and amount of each type of funds and each of the virtual currencies involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: of the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: of every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the amount received is in virtual currency, of every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: if it redeems one or more money orders that total $3,000 or more at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the redemption,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total amount of the money order or orders,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the issuer of each money order,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the redemption, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the redemption and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the redemption involves virtual currency, every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: if it initiates an international electronic funds transfer — or any other electronic funds transfer that is a SWIFT MT-103 message or its equivalent — of $1,000 or more at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is initiated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the initiation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address and telephone number, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the initiation, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (vi);

Paragraph.Label: (p)
Paragraph.Text: if it sends an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more that was initiated by another person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is sent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it exchanges fiat currencies in the course of sending the electronic funds transfer, the type and amount of each fiat currency that is involved in the exchange,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number;

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known;

Paragraph.Label: (q)
Paragraph.Text: if it is the final recipient of an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the final receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address a of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in funds, the type and amount of each type of funds involved in the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in funds, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of funds finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the final receipt or the remittance, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (viii), and

Paragraph.Label: (r)
Paragraph.Text: if it transfers an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the transfer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency that is involved in the transfer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Paragraph.Label: (s)
Paragraph.Text: if it receives an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency for remittance to a beneficiary, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency that is received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in virtual currency, the type and amount of each virtual currency involved in the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in virtual currency, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of virtual currency received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the transfer unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known;

Paragraph.Label: (t)
Paragraph.Text: a virtual currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every virtual currency exchange transaction.

Section.Text: The heading before section 11.1 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Heading.TitleText: Information with Respect to Directors of a Corporation or Other Entity, Persons Who Own or Control 25% or More of a Corporation or Other Entity and Beneficiaries and Settlors of a Trust
— SOR/2019-240, s. 27, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 5

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 11.1(1) of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:
Every person or entity that is required to verify an entity’s identity in accordance with these Regulations shall, at the time the entity’s identity is verified, obtain the following information:

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, SOR/2020-112, s. 5]

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 11.1(1)(a) of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a corporation, the names of all directors of the corporation and the names and addresses of all persons who own or control, directly or indirectly, 25% or more of the shares of the corporation;

Subsection.Text: Subsection 11.1(1) of the Regulations is amended by adding the following after paragraph (a):

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a widely held or publicly traded trust, the names of all trustees of the trust and the names and addresses of all persons who own or control, directly or indirectly, 25% or more of the units of the trust;

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 11.1(1)(c) of the English version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an entity other than a corporation or trust, the names and addresses of all persons who own or control, directly or indirectly, 25% or more of the entity; and

Subsection.Text: Subsections 11.1(2) to (4) of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Text.Repealed: [Repealed before coming into force, SOR/2020-112, s. 5]

Subsection.Text: Every person and entity that is subject to subsection (1) shall take reasonable measures to confirm the accuracy of the information when it is first obtained under that subsection and in the course of ongoing monitoring of business relationships.
The person or entity shall keep a record that sets out the information and the measures taken to confirm the accuracy of the information.

If the person or entity is not able to obtain the information, to keep it up to date in the course of ongoing monitoring of business relationships or to confirm its accuracy, the person or entity shall take

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reasonable measures to verify the identity of the entity’s chief executive officer or the person who performs that function; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the special measures referred to in section 157.

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 11.1(5) of the Regulations before paragraph (a) is replaced by the following:
If the entity whose identity is being verified under subsection (1) is a not-for-profit organization, the person or entity shall determine and keep a record that sets out whether that entity is
Section 11.1 of the Regulations is renumbered as section 138 and that section 138 and the heading before it are repositioned accordingly.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 28, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 6

Section.Text: The headings before section 11.2 and sections 11.2 to 33.2 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:
A financial entity shall keep the following records in respect of every credit card account that it opens and of every transaction that is connected to that account:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a record for each account holder and every other person — up to three, in the case of a business account — who is authorized to give instructions in respect of the account, containing their name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an account holder is a corporation, a copy of the part of its official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of the account or transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a record of every application in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of every credit card statement that it sends to an account holder;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every foreign currency exchange transaction that is connected to the account;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if it initiates an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more at the request of a person or entity and the funds are transferred from the account, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is initiated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the initiation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address and telephone number, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the initiation, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (vi); and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if it is the final recipient of an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more and the remittance to the beneficiary is by payment to the account, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the final receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds involved in the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the final receipt or the remittance, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (vii); and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a virtual currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every virtual currency exchange transaction that is connected to the account.

Subsection.Text: A financial entity shall keep the following records in respect of every prepaid payment product account that it opens and of every transaction that is made by means of a prepaid payment product that is connected to that account:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the name and address of each holder of a prepaid payment product account and each authorized user, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an account holder is a corporation, a copy of the part of its official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of the prepaid payment product account or the transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a record of every application in respect of the prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a prepaid payment product slip in respect of every payment that is made to the prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: every debit and credit memo that it creates or receives in respect of the prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of every account statement that it sends to a holder of the prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every foreign currency exchange transaction that is connected to the prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if it initiates an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more at the request of a person or entity and the funds are transferred from the prepaid payment product account, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is initiated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the initiation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address and telephone number, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the initiation, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (vi);

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: if it is the final recipient of an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more and the remittance to the beneficiary is by payment to the prepaid payment product account, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the final receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in funds, the type and amount of each type of funds involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in funds, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of funds finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the final receipt or the remittance, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (viii);

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: if it transfers from a prepaid payment product account an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the transfer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency that is involved in the transfer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: if it receives an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency for remittance to a beneficiary by payment to the prepaid payment product account, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency that is received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in virtual currency, the type and amount of each virtual currency involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in virtual currency, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of virtual currency received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the transfer unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a virtual currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every virtual currency exchange transaction that is connected to the prepaid payment product account.

Subsection.Text: In this section, prepaid payment product slip means a record that sets out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of a payment to a prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person or entity that makes the payment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds or each of the virtual currencies involved in the payment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the method by which the payment is made;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of each holder of the prepaid payment product account; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
