Paragraph.Text: the account number and, if different, the number that identifies the prepaid payment product that is connected to the account.

Subsection.Text: A trust company shall also keep the following records in respect of a trust for which it is trustee:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the trust deed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the settlor’s name and address and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the settlor is a person, their date of birth and the nature of their principal business or their occupation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the settlor is an entity, the nature of its principal business; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the trust is an institutional trust and the settlor is a corporation, a copy of the part of the official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of the trust.

Subsection.Text: In this section, institutional trust means a trust that is established by a corporation or other entity for a particular business purpose and includes a pension plan trust, a pension master trust, a supplemental pension plan trust, a mutual fund trust, a pooled fund trust, a registered retirement savings plan trust, a registered retirement income fund trust, a registered education savings plan trust, a group registered retirement savings plan trust, a deferred profit sharing plan trust, an employee profit sharing plan trust, a retirement compensation arrangement trust, an employee savings plan trust, a health and welfare trust, an unemployment benefit plan trust, a foreign insurance company trust, a foreign reinsurance trust, a reinsurance trust, a real estate investment trust, an environmental trust and a trust established in respect of an endowment, a foundation or a registered charity.
For the purposes of subsections 9.4(1) and (3) of the Act,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed entity is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an entity referred to in paragraph 5(e.1) or (f) of the Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a financial services cooperative,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a life insurance company, or an entity that is a life insurance broker or agent, in respect of loans or prepaid payment products that it offers to the public or accounts that it maintains with respect to those loans or prepaid payment products, other than

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: loans that are made by the insurer to a policy holder if the insured person has a terminal illness that significantly reduces their life expectancy and the loan is secured by the value of an insurance policy,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: loans that are made by the insurer to the policy holder for the sole purpose of funding the life insurance policy, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: advance payments to which the policy holder is entitled that are made to them by the insurer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a credit union central when it offers financial services to a person, or to an entity that is not a member of that credit union central, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a department, or an entity that is an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province, when it accepts deposit liabilities in the course of providing financial services to the public; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed foreign entity is a foreign financial institution.

Subsection.Text: A financial entity shall, when it enters into a correspondent banking relationship, keep the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the foreign financial institution’s name and address, its primary business line and the names of its directors;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the foreign financial institution’s most recent annual report or audited financial statement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the foreign financial institution’s banking licence, banking charter, authorization or certification to operate issued by the competent authority under the legislation of the jurisdiction in which the foreign financial institution was incorporated, of its certificate of incorporation or of a similar document;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the correspondent banking agreement or arrangement, or product agreements, defining the respective responsibilities of the financial entity and the foreign financial institution;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the anticipated correspondent banking account activity of the foreign financial institution, including the products or services to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a written statement from the foreign financial institution that it does not have, directly or indirectly, a correspondent banking relationship with a shell bank;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a written statement from the foreign financial institution that it is in compliance with anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing legislation in every jurisdiction in which it operates; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the measures taken to ascertain whether any civil or criminal penalties have been imposed on the foreign financial institution in respect of anti-money laundering or anti-terrorist financing requirements and the results of those measures.

Subsection.Text: The financial entity shall take reasonable measures to ascertain whether the foreign financial institution has in place anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing policies and procedures, including procedures for approval for the opening of new accounts and, if the reasonable measures are unsuccessful or the policies and procedures are not in place, shall, for the purpose of detecting any transactions that are required to be reported to the Centre under section 7 of the Act, take reasonable measures to monitor all transactions conducted in the context of the correspondent banking relationship.
For greater certainty, section 12 does not apply in respect of an account that is opened for a foreign financial institution in the context of a correspondent banking relationship.

Heading.TitleText: Life Insurance Companies and Life Insurance Brokers or Agents

Subsection.Text: A life insurance broker or agent is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(i) of the Act.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a life insurance broker or agent when they are acting as a managing general agent.

Section.Text: A life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash from a person or entity in a single transaction shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transaction

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: involves the sale of an immediate or deferred annuity that is paid for entirely with funds that are directly transferred from a registered pension plan or from a pension plan that is required to be registered under the Pension Benefits Standards Act, 1985, or similar provincial legislation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: involves the sale of a registered annuity policy or a registered retirement income fund,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: involves the sale of an immediate or deferred annuity that is paid for entirely with the proceeds of a group life insurance policy, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: is part of a reverse mortgage or structured settlement.

Section.Text: A life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency from a person or entity in a single transaction shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transaction

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: involves the sale of an immediate or deferred annuity that is paid for entirely with funds that are directly transferred from a registered pension plan or from a pension plan that is required to be registered under the Pension Benefits Standards Act, 1985, or similar provincial legislation,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: involves the sale of a registered annuity policy or a registered retirement income fund,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: involves the sale of an immediate or deferred annuity that is paid for entirely with the proceeds of a group life insurance policy, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: is part of a reverse mortgage or structured settlement.

Section.Text: A life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Subsection.Text: A life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent shall, regardless of the means of payment, keep an information record in connection with the sale of an immediate or deferred annuity or a life insurance policy

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for which they are to receive an amount of $10,000 or more over the duration of the annuity or policy; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: under which they are to remit an amount of $10,000 or more to a beneficiary over the duration of the annuity or policy.

Subsection.Text: The information record

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in connection with the sale referred to in paragraph (1)(a) shall be created when the life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent establishes the annuity or policy and shall be kept, subject to subsection (3), in respect of the annuitant or policy holder; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in connection with the sale referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall be created before the life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent first remits funds or virtual currency to the beneficiary under the annuity or policy and shall be kept in respect of the beneficiary.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a life insurance policy that is a group life insurance policy or in the case of a group annuity, the information record shall be kept in respect of the applicant for the policy or annuity.

Paragraph (2)(b) does not apply if the life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent, due to facts or circumstances beyond its control, is unable to create the information record within the time period in which they are required, under federal or provincial legislation, to first remit funds or virtual currency to the beneficiary.

Section.Text: A life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent that keeps an information record under section 22 in respect of a corporation shall also keep a copy of the part of the official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent.
Sections 18 to 23 do not apply to a life insurance company or life insurance broker or agent when they are dealing in reinsurance.

Heading.TitleText: Securities Dealers

Section.Text: A securities dealer that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash from a person or entity in a single transaction shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A securities dealer that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency from a person or entity in a single transaction shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A securities dealer shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A securities dealer shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
A securities dealer shall keep the following records in respect of every account that they open:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every signature card;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a record for each account holder and every other person — up to three, in the case of a business account — who is authorized to give instructions in respect of the account, containing their name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if an account holder is a corporation, a copy of the part of its official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a record that sets out the intended use of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a record of every application in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: every account operating agreement that they create or receive in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: every confirmation of purchase or sale, guarantee, trade authorization, power of attorney and joint account agreement and all correspondence that pertains to the operation of the account; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of every account statement that they send to an account holder.

Heading.TitleText: Money Services Businesses and Foreign Money Services Businesses

Subsection.Text: A money services business shall report the following transactions and information to the Centre:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity of an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the initiation, at the request of a person or entity, of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the final receipt of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 3;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the initiation, at the request of a person or entity, of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 2, if the money services business also finally receives or is to finally receive the electronic funds transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the final receipt of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 3, if the money services business also initiated the electronic funds transfer; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity of an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

Subsection.Text: A money services business is not required to report the transaction and information under paragraph (1)(a) if the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Section.Text: A money services business shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A money services business shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Subsection.Text: A foreign money services business shall report the following transactions and information to the Centre:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity in Canada of an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the initiation, at the request of a person or entity in Canada, of an electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 2, if the electronic funds transfer is sent or is to be sent from one country to another;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the final receipt of an electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 3, if the electronic funds transfer was sent from one country to another and the beneficiary is in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the initiation, at the request of a person or entity in Canada, of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 2, if the foreign money services business also finally receives or is to finally receive the electronic funds transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the final receipt of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 3, if the foreign money services business also initiated the electronic funds transfer and the beneficiary is in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity in Canada of an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

Subsection.Text: A foreign money services business is not required to report the transaction and information under paragraph (1)(a) if the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Section.Text: A foreign money services business shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive from a person or entity in Canada in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A foreign money services business shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive from a person or entity in Canada in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A money services business shall keep the following records in connection with a service referred to in any of subparagraphs 5(h)(i) to (v) of the Act that they provide, and a foreign money services business shall keep the following records in connection with a service referred to in any of subparagraphs 5(h.1)(i) to (v) of the Act that they provide to persons or entities in Canada:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every internal memorandum that they create or receive that concerns the service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they receive an amount of $3,000 or more from a person or entity — other than a financial entity or a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity — as consideration for the issuance of traveller’s cheques, money orders or similar negotiable instruments, a record

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: of the date of the receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: of the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: of the amount received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: indicating whether the amount received is in funds or virtual currency and the type and amount of each type of funds and each of the virtual currencies involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: of the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: of every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the amount received is in virtual currency, of every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if they redeem one or more money orders that total $3,000 or more at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the redemption,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total amount of the money order or orders,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the issuer of each money order,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the redemption, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the redemption and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the redemption involves virtual currency, every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: if they transmit an amount of $1,000 or more in funds at the request of a person or entity, other than in the case of an electronic funds transfer, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the transmission,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the transmission,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address and telephone number, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number;

Paragraph.Label: (c.2)
Paragraph.Text: if they remit an amount of $1,000 or more in funds to a beneficiary at the request of a person or entity, other than in the case of an electronic funds transfer, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the person or entity who requested the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if they initiate an electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is initiated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the initiation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address and telephone number, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the initiation, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (vi);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if they send an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more that was initiated by another person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is sent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if they exchange fiat currencies in the course of sending the electronic funds transfer, the type and amount of each fiat currency that is involved in the exchange,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the sending, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the sending and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if they are the final recipient of an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the final receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in funds, the type and amount of each type of funds involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in funds, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of funds finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the final receipt or the remittance, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (viii);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if they transfer an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the transfer,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency that is involved in the transfer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if they receive an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency for remittance to a beneficiary, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each virtual currency that is received,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in virtual currency, the type and amount of each virtual currency involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in virtual currency, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of virtual currency received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the transfer unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every foreign currency exchange transaction; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: a virtual currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every virtual currency exchange transaction.

Section.Text: A money services business that enters into an agreement with an entity to provide a service referred to in any of subparagraphs 5(h)(i) to (v) of the Act to that entity — and a foreign money services business that enters into an agreement with an entity in Canada to provide a service referred to in any of subparagraphs 5(h.1)(i) to (v) of the Act to that entity — shall keep

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the name, address and date of birth of every person who signs the agreement on behalf of the entity and the nature of the person’s principal business or their occupation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an information record in respect of the entity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the entity is a corporation, a copy of the part of its official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the money services business or foreign money services business; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list containing the name, address and date of birth of every employee of the entity who is authorized to order a transaction under the agreement.

Heading.TitleText: British Columbia Notaries Public and British Columbia Notary Corporations

Subsection.Text: A British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(j) of the Act when, on behalf of a person or entity, they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: receive or pay funds or virtual currency, other than in respect of professional fees, disbursements, expenses or bail;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: purchase or sell securities, real property or immovables or business assets or entities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transfer funds, virtual currency or securities by any means; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: give instructions in connection with an activity referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a British Columbia notary public who is acting in the capacity of an employee.

Section.Text: A British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 38 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 38 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 38, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 38, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
Section 33.3 of the Regulations is renumbered as section 44 and that section 44 and the heading before it are repositioned accordingly.
Sections 33.4 and 33.5 of the Regulations are renumbered as sections 45 and 46, respectively, and are repositioned accordingly.
Section 34 of the Regulations and the heading before it are replaced by the following:
A British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation shall keep the following records in connection with an activity referred to in section 38:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a receipt of funds record in respect of every amount of $3,000 or more that they receive, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the receipt of funds record is in respect of a corporation, a copy of the part of official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the British Columbia notary public or British Columbia notary corporation.

Section.Text: Section 35 of the Regulations, as enacted by SOR/2002-184, is repealed.

Subsection.Text: The portion of subsection 36(1) of the Regulations before paragraph (a), as enacted by section 15 of the Regulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act (2007-2), SOR/2007-293, is repealed.

Paragraphs 36(1)(a) and (b) of the Regulations, as enacted by section 40 of the Regulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act (2007-1), SOR/2007-122, are repealed.

Subsections 36(2) and (3) of the Regulations, as enacted by section 40 of the Regulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act (2007-1), SOR/2007-122, are repealed.

Section.Text: The heading before section 37 of the Regulations, as enacted by SOR/2002-184, is repealed.

Section 37 of the Regulations, as enacted by section 41 of the Regulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act (2007-1), SOR/2007-122, is repealed.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 36, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 7

Section.Text: Sections 38 to 59.32 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Heading.TitleText: Accountants and Accounting Firms

Subsection.Text: An accountant or accounting firm is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(j) of the Act when, on behalf of a person or entity, they

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: receive or pay funds or virtual currency;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: purchase or sell securities, real property or immovables or business assets or entities;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transfer funds, virtual currency or securities by any means; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: give instructions in connection with an activity referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (c).

Subsection.Text: For greater certainty, the activities in subsection (1) do not include activities that are carried out in the course of an audit, a review or a compilation engagement within the meaning of the CPA Canada Handbook prepared and published by the Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada, as amended from time to time.

Subsection (1) does not apply to an accountant who is acting in the capacity of an employee or of a person who either is authorized by law to carry on the business of — or to monitor the business or financial affairs of — an insolvent or bankrupt person or entity or is authorized to act under a security agreement.

Section.Text: An accountant or accounting firm that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 47 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

An accountant or accounting firm that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 47 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

An accountant or accounting firm shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 47, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

An accountant or accounting firm shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 47, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
An accountant or accounting firm shall keep the following records in connection with an activity referred to in section 47:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a receipt of funds record in respect of every amount of $3,000 or more that they receive, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the receipt of funds record is in respect of a corporation, a copy of the part of official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the accountant or accounting firm.

Heading.TitleText: Real Estate Brokers or Sales Representatives

Section.Text: A real estate broker or sales representative is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(j) of the Act when they act as an agent or mandatary for a purchaser or vendor in respect of the purchase or sale of real property or immovables.

A real estate broker or sales representative that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 53 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A real estate broker or sales representative that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 53 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A real estate broker or sales representative shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 53, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A real estate broker or sales representative shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 53, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Subsection.Text: A real estate broker or sales representative shall keep the following records in connection with an activity referred to in section 53:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a receipt of funds record in respect of every amount that they receive, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an information record in respect of every person or entity for which they act as an agent or mandatary in respect of the purchase or sale of real property or immovables; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the receipt of funds record or information record is in respect of a corporation, a copy of the part of official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the real estate broker or sales representative.

Subsection.Text: If two or more of the parties to a transaction are represented by a real estate broker or sales representative and one of those real estate brokers or sales representatives receives funds in respect of the transaction from a party that is represented by another real estate broker or sales representative, the real estate broker or sales representative that represents the party from which the funds are received is responsible for keeping the receipt of funds record referred to in paragraph (1)(a) and, if applicable, the copy referred to in paragraph (1)(c).

A real estate broker or sales representative that is responsible under subsection (2) for keeping a receipt of funds record is not required to include in that record any of the following information if, after taking reasonable measures to do so, they are unable to obtain it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number and type of an account that is affected by the transaction referred to in subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of a holder of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a reference number that is connected to the transaction.

Subsection.Text: A real estate broker or sales representative that is responsible under subsection (2) for keeping a receipt of funds record and that determines that the transaction affects a trust account held by another real estate broker or sales representative shall include that information in the record but is not required to include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the trust account; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the holder or holders of the trust account.

Heading.TitleText: Real Estate Developers

Section.Text: A real estate developer is engaged in a business or profession for the purposes of paragraph 5(j) of the Act when they sell a new house, new condominium unit, new commercial or industrial building or new multi-unit residential building to the public, including, if they are a corporation, when they do so on behalf of a subsidiary or affiliate.

A real estate developer that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 59 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A real estate developer that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 59 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A real estate developer shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 59, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A real estate developer shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 59, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
A real estate developer shall keep the following records in connection with an activity referred to in section 59:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a receipt of funds record in respect of every amount that they receive, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an information record in respect of every person or entity to which they sell a new house, new condominium unit, new commercial or industrial building or new multi-unit residential building; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the receipt of funds record or information record is in respect of a corporation, a copy of the part of official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the real estate developer.

Heading.TitleText: Dealers in Precious Metals and Precious Stones

Subsection.Text: A dealer in precious metals and precious stones, other than a department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province, that buys or sells precious metals, precious stones or jewellery, for an amount of $10,000 or more is engaged in an activity for the purposes of paragraph 5(i) of the Act. A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province carries out an activity for the purposes of paragraph 5(l) of the Act when they sell precious metals to the public for an amount of $10,000 or more.

The activities referred to in subsection (1) do not include a purchase or sale that is carried out in the course of or in connection with manufacturing a product that contains precious metals or precious stones, extracting precious metals or precious stones from a mine or polishing or cutting precious stones.

For greater certainty, the activities referred to in subsection (1) include the sale of precious metals, precious stones or jewellery that are left on consignment with a dealer in precious metals and precious stones. Goods left with an auctioneer for sale at auction are not considered to be left on consignment.

Section.Text: A dealer in precious metals and precious stones that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 65 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A dealer in precious metals and precious stones that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 65 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A dealer in precious metals and precious stones shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 65, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A dealer in precious metals and precious stones shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 65, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Heading.TitleText: Casinos

Subsection.Text: A casino shall report the following transactions and information to the Centre:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity of an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 1;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the initiation, at the request of a person or entity, of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 2;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the final receipt of an international electronic funds transfer of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 3; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the receipt from a person or entity of an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

Subsection.Text: A casino is not required to report the transaction and information under paragraph (1)(a) if the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Section.Text: A casino shall report to the Centre the disbursement, in any of the following transactions, of $10,000 or more in a single transaction, together with the information set out in Schedule 6:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the redemption of chips, tokens or plaques;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a front cash withdrawal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a safekeeping withdrawal;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an advance on any form of credit, including an advance by a marker or a counter cheque;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a payment on a bet, including a slot jackpot;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a payment to a client of funds received for credit to that client or another client;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the cashing of a cheque or the redemption of another negotiable instrument; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a reimbursement to a client of travel or entertainment expenses.

Subsection.Text: A casino shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that the casino receives from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.
For greater certainty, the transactions referred to in subsection (1) include the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the sale of chips, tokens or plaques;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a front cash deposit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a safekeeping deposit;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the repayment of any form of credit, including repayment by a marker or a counter cheque;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a bet of fiat currency; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a sale of the casino’s cheques.

Section.Text: A casino shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that the casino receives from a person or entity in a single transaction, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Subsection.Text: A casino shall keep the following records in respect of every account that the casino opens:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: every signature card;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the name, address and telephone number of each account holder and of every other person who is authorized to give instructions in respect of the account, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if an account holder is a corporation, a copy of the part of official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of the transaction or account;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a record that sets out the intended use of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a record of every application in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: every account operating agreement that the casino creates or receives in respect of the account;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a deposit slip in respect of every deposit that is made into the account; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: every debit and credit memo that the casino creates or receives in respect of the account.

Subsection.Text: A casino shall keep the following records in respect of every transaction that is conducted with it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the casino extends credit of $3,000 or more to a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name and address, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the terms of the extension of credit, the date on which credit was extended and the amount of credit extended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a foreign currency exchange transaction ticket in respect of every foreign currency exchange transaction;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the casino initiates an electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more at the request of a person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is initiated,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the initiation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person’s or entity’s name, address and telephone number, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the initiation, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (vi);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the casino sends an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more that was initiated by another person or entity, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is sent,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the casino exchanges fiat currencies in the course of sending the electronic funds transfer, the type and amount of each fiat currency that is involved in the exchange,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the sending, the type of account and the name of each account holder, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the sending and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of each beneficiary, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the casino is the final recipient of an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more, a record of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the electronic funds transfer is finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type and amount of each type of funds that is involved in the final receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of each beneficiary, the nature of their principal business or their occupation and, in the case of a person, their date of birth,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the remittance,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the exchange rates used for the remittance and their source,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is in funds, the type and amount of each type of funds involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the remittance is not in funds, the type of remittance and its value, if different from the amount of funds finally received,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the final receipt or the remittance, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: every reference number that is connected to the electronic funds transfer and has a function equivalent to that of an account number,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person or entity that requested the initiation of the electronic funds transfer, unless that information was not, despite the taking of reasonable measures, included with the transfer and is not otherwise known, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of every account that is affected by the electronic funds transfer, other than those referred to in subparagraph (viii); and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the casino receives an amount of $3,000 or more from a person or entity in a single transaction, a receipt of funds record in respect of that amount, unless that amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 70 to 74, if a registered charity, as defined in subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act, conducts and manages, in a permanent establishment of a casino, for a period of not more than two consecutive days at a time, a lottery scheme that includes games of roulette or card games and, in doing so, acts under the supervision of the government of a province that is referred to in paragraph 5(k) of the Act, or of an organization that is referred to in paragraph 5(k.2) of the Act, that conducts and manages such a lottery scheme in the same establishment, the lottery scheme that is conducted and managed by the registered charity is considered to be conducted and managed by the supervising government or organization.

Heading.TitleText: Departments and Agents or Mandataries of Her Majesty in Right of Canada or of a Province

Section.Text: A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province carries out an activity for the purposes of paragraph 5(l) of the Act when they accept deposit liabilities in the course of providing financial services to the public.

A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province carries out an activity for the purposes of paragraph 5(l) of the Act when they issue, sell or redeem money orders in the course of providing financial services to the public.
Sections 59.4, 59.41 and 59.42 of the Regulations are renumbered as sections 97, 98 and 99, respectively, and the heading before section 97 and sections 97 to 99 are repositioned accordingly.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 38, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 8

Section.Text: The heading before section 59.5 and sections 59.5 to 66.1 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in cash in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 77 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 1, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province that receives an amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 77 shall report the transaction to the Centre, together with the information set out in Schedule 4.

A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province shall keep a large cash transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in cash that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 77, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province shall keep a large virtual currency transaction record in respect of every amount of $10,000 or more in virtual currency that they receive in a single transaction in connection with an activity referred to in section 77, unless the amount is received from a financial entity or public body or from a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity or public body.

A department or an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or an agent or mandatary of Her Majesty in right of a province shall keep the following records in connection with an activity referred to in section 77:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if they receive an amount of $3,000 or more as consideration for the issuance or sale of one or more money orders from a person or entity other than either a financial entity or a person who is acting on behalf of a client that is a financial entity,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the date of the receipt,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a person, a record of their name, address, date of birth and the nature of their principal business or their occupation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an entity, an information record,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the amount received,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a record indicating whether the amount received is in funds or virtual currency and the type and amount of each type of funds and each of the virtual currencies involved,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the number of every account that is affected by the transaction, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of every reference number that is connected to the transaction and has a function equivalent to that of an account number, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the amount received is in virtual currency, every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if they redeem one or more money orders that total $3,000 or more at the request of a person or entity,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the date of the redemption,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a person, a record of their name, address, date of birth and the nature of their principal business or their occupation,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an entity, an information record,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the total amount of the money order or orders,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the name of the issuer of each money order,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of the number of every account that is affected by the redemption, the type of account and the name of each account holder,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of every reference number that is connected to the redemption and has a function equivalent to that of an account number; and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the redemption involves virtual currency, every transaction identifier, including the sending and receiving addresses; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the information record is in respect of a corporation, a copy of the part of official corporate records that contains any provision relating to the power to bind the corporation in respect of transactions with the department or the agent or mandatary.

Heading.Label: PART 2
Heading.TitleText: Requirement To Verify Identity
Application of Parts 5 and 6

Section.Text: The provisions of this Part are subject to the provisions of Parts 5 and 6.

Heading.TitleText: Persons and Entities Required To Keep Large Cash Transaction Record or Large Virtual Currency Transaction Record

Section.Text: A person or entity shall verify, in accordance with section 105, 109 or 112, the identity of a person or entity from which they receive an amount

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of which they are required to keep a large cash transaction record under these Regulations, unless the amount is received as a deposit made into a business account or a deposit made by means of an automated banking machine; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of which they are required to keep a large virtual currency transaction record under these Regulations.

Heading.TitleText: Suspicious Transactions

Subsection.Text: A person or entity that is subject to these Regulations shall take reasonable measures to verify, in accordance with section 105, 109 or 112, the identity of a person or entity that conducts or attempts to conduct a transaction with them that is required to be reported to the Centre under section 7 of the Act.

If the person or entity believes that taking the reasonable measures would inform the person or entity that conducts or attempts to conduct a transaction with them that the transaction and related information will be reported under section 7 of the Act, they are not required to comply with subsection (1).

Heading.TitleText: Financial Entities

Section.Text: A financial entity shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 105, verify the identity of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person for whom it opens an account, other than a credit card account or a prepaid payment product account,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person, other than an account holder, who is authorized to give instructions in respect of an account, other than a credit card account or a prepaid payment product account, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person – other than one referred to in subparagraph (i) or (ii) — who

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: requests that it issue or redeem money orders, traveller’s cheques or similar negotiable instruments in an amount of $3,000 or more,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: requests that it initiate an international electronic funds transfer — or any other electronic funds transfer that is a SWIFT MT-103 message or its equivalent — of $1,000 or more,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: requests that it exchange an amount of $3,000 or more in a foreign currency exchange transaction,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: requests that it transfer an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: requests that it exchange an amount of $1,000 or more in a virtual currency exchange transaction, or

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: is the beneficiary of an international electronic funds transfer of $1,000 or more, or of a transfer of an amount of $1,000 or more in virtual currency, to whom it makes the remittance;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 109, verify the identity of a corporation for which it opens an account, other than a credit card account or a prepaid payment product account; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 112, verify the identity of an entity, other than a corporation, for which it opens an account, other than a credit card account or a prepaid payment product account.

Heading.TitleText: — SOR/2019-240, s. 40, as amended by SOR/2020-112, s. 9

Section.Text: The heading before section 67.1 and sections 67.1 to 76 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:
A financial entity shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 105, verify the identity of a person for whom it opens a credit card account;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 109, verify the identity of a corporation for which it opens a credit card account; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 112, verify the identity of an entity, other than a corporation, for which it opens a credit card account.

Section.Text: A financial entity shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 105, verify the identity of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a person for whom it opens a prepaid payment product account,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an authorized user, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other person who makes a payment of $1,000 or more to a prepaid payment product account;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 109, verify the identity of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a corporation for which it opens a prepaid payment product account, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other corporation that makes a payment of $1,000 or more to a prepaid payment product account; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 112, verify the identity of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an entity, other than a corporation, for which it opens a prepaid payment product account, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other entity, other than a corporation, that makes a payment of $1,000 or more to a prepaid payment product account.

Section.Text: A trust company shall also

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 105, verify the identity of a person who is the settlor of an inter vivos trust in respect of which it is required to keep a record under subsection 15(1);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 109, verify the identity of a corporation that is the settlor of an institutional trust in respect of which it is required to keep a record under subsection 15(1);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 112, verify the identity of an entity, other than a corporation, that is the settlor of an institutional trust in respect of which it is required to keep a record under subsection 15(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with section 105, verify the identity of a person who is authorized to act as a co-trustee of a trust; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if an entity is authorized to act as a co-trustee of a trust,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with section 105, verify the identity of all persons — up to three — who are authorized to give instructions with respect to the entity’s activities as co-trustee, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with section 109 or 112, verify the identity of the entity.

Section.Text: A financial entity that enters into a correspondent banking relationship

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall ascertain the name and address of the foreign financial institution by examining a copy of the foreign financial institution’s banking licence, banking charter, authorization or certification to operate issued by the competent authority under the legislation of the jurisdiction in which the foreign financial institution was incorporated, of its certificate of incorporation or of a similar document; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall take reasonable measures to ascertain, based on information that is accessible to the public, whether any civil or criminal penalties have been imposed on the foreign financial institution in respect of anti-money laundering or anti-terrorist financing requirements and, if such a penalty has been imposed, shall, for the purpose of detecting any transactions that are required to be reported to the Centre under section 7 of the Act, monitor all transactions conducted in the context of the correspondent banking relationship.

Section.Text: If a client of a foreign financial institution has direct access to services provided by the financial entity under a correspondent banking relationship, the financial entity shall take reasonable measures to ascertain whether the foreign financial institution

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has, in respect of its clients that have direct access to the accounts of the financial entity, met requirements that are consistent with the requirements of section 86; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has agreed to provide relevant client identification information on request to the financial entity.
